article.headline: Chattanooga 85, ETSU 76
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. -- Keegan Bell had 23 points and seven assists to lead Chattanooga to an 85-76 win over East Tennessee State on Tuesday night. Trailing 60-55 with 15:40 left in the game, the Mocs (2-0) went on a 25-8 run throughout the next 15 minutes. Ricky Taylor gave Chattanooga an 80-68 lead on a free throw with 56 seconds to play. The Mocs forced 10 second-half turnovers, and finished the game with 26 points off of 19 Buccaneers' give-aways. Ridge McKeither scored 17 points and had nine rebounds for the Mocs and Josh Edem added 14 points and four steals. Chattanooga was 11 of 28 from 3-point range (39.3 percent), as Bell was 6 of 10 from behind the arc. The Mocs shot 53.8 percent from 3-point range in the first half (7 of 13). The Buccaneers (1-1) were led by Tommy Hubbard with 26 points and 13 rebounds. Isiah Brown added 13 points and Jocolby Davis chipped in 11 for ETSU.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
